newsitem.title: USA: Dayton Hudson August same store sales up.
newsitem.headline: Dayton Hudson August same store sales up.

text.p: Dayton Hudson Corp said Thursday its same store sales for the four weeks ended August 31 increased 1.9 percent.
Net retail sales for the four weeks increased 9.2 percent to $1.93 billion from $1.77 billion a year ago, it added.
"Sales in August were on plan at Target and Mervyn's, and below plan at the Department Store Division," said Bob Ulrich, chairman.

Dayton said Target's total sales for the month increased 15.7 percent and comparable store sales increased six percent. Year-to-date, Target's total sales increased 16.9 percent and comparable store sales increased eight percent.

Mervyn's total sales for August decreased 3.8 percent and comparable store sales decreased 4.2 percent. Year-to-date, Mervyn's total sales increased 0.5 percent and comparable store sales decreased 1.7 percent, Dayton said.

The Department Store Division's total sales for the month decreased 3.3 percent and same store sales decreased 9.1 percent. Year-to-date, the Department Stores total sales decreased 1.6 percent and same store sales decreased 3.8 percent, it added.
Dayton said total company sales for the 30 weeks ended August 31 were $12.84 billion, up 11.3 percent from the $11.54 billion in the same period a year ago.
Same store sales for the year-to-date period were up 4.6 percent.
